page.title: 01EDGEFIELD AND AREA
page.content: Edgefield has a population of about 400 most of whom live in the village, but some in scattered farms throughout the area which is primarily concerned with agriculture. There is one shop, which is also a Post Office,one public house and one garage/petrol station. Those who are not employed in the village travel to neighbouring towns to work: Holt,3 miles, Sheringham,6 miles, or even Norwich,20 miles. There are also retired people in the village, some who have always lived here, and some who have chosen it as a pleasant place for retirement. Houses in the village are mostly of warm red brick, combined with flint. The landscape is varied with woodland, ponds and small streams and hedgerows rich with colour from wild flowers and berries.
